form.longName: PhenX PX730101 - History Of Switching To Lower Tar And Nicotine Cigarette
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer-administered National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) protocol consists of two questions that should be used on respondents 18 years or older to determine number of times a smoker has gone a day without smoking and whether a respondent has ever switched to cigarettes perceived as less harmful.

module.longName: History of Switching to Lower Tar and Nicotine Cigarettes
module.preferredDefinition: History of Switching to Lower Tar and Nicotine Cigarettes

question.questionText: Did you ever use or switch to a lower tar and nicotine cigarette to reduce your health risk? (ever_switch_lowertarnicotine_health)
Have you ever stopped smoking for one day or longer because you were trying to quit smoking? (ever_stopped_smoking_trying_toquit)
In your whole life, how many times have you stopped smoking for one day or longer because you were trying to quit smoking? (wholelife_times_stoped_smoking_tryingquit)

protocol.longName: History of Switching to Lower Tar and Nicotine Cigarettes
protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer-administered National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) protocol consists of two questions that should be used on respondents 18 years or older to determine number of times a smoker has gone a day without smoking and whether a respondent has ever switched to cigarettes perceived as less harmful.

form.longName: PhenX PX730502 - Physical Properties Of Tobacco Products Smokeless Tobacco
form.preferredDefinition: This is a Federal Register Notice laboratory measurement protocol providing instructions for measuring the total moisture content within smokeless tobacco products (i.e., dry snuff, moist [wet] snuff, moist [wet] snuff portion packs, plug, twist, loose leaf, dry snuff portions packs, snus, snus portion packs, and pellet or compressed).

headerInstruction.text: Sample Preparation.There are ten different categories of commercial smokeless tobacco products:1) Dry snuff 2) Moist (wet) snuff 3) Moist (wet) snuff portion packs 4) Plug 5) Twist 6) Loose leaf 7) Dry snuff portion packs 8) Snus 9) Snus porti..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Physical Properties of Tobacco Products - Smokeless Tobacco
module.preferredDefinition: Physical Properties of Tobacco Products - Smokeless Tobacco

question.questionText: * Use a statistical program to determine random sampling dates based on the total manufacturing duration during a calendar year. Sampling dates should fall on actual manufacturing days for the product when test material that is representative of the product that is sold to the public (consisting of sealed, packaged samples) is available. If a statistically determined sampling date falls on a day that does not meet this criterion, sample the product on the next date that does meet the criteria. 11The testing facility must ensure that samples are obtained through the use of a survey design protocol for sampling ''at one point in time'' at the factory or warehouse. The survey design protocol must address short-, medium-, and long-term smokeless tobacco product variability (e.g., variability over time and from container to container of the tobacco product) in a manner equivalent to that described for cigarette sampling in Annex C of ISO Protocol 8243. Information accompanying results for each sample should include, but not be limited to: For each product-manufacturer and variety (including brand families and brand variations) and brand name (e.g., Skoal Bandits, Skoal Long Cut Cherry, Skoal Long Cut Wintergreen, etc.): ? Product ''category,'' e.g., loose leaf, plug, twist, dry snuff, moist (wet) snuff, etc. ? Lot number.? Lot size.? Number of randomly sampled, sealed, packaged (so as to be representative of the product that is sold to the public) smokeless tobacco products selected (sampling fraction) for nicotine, moisture, and pH determination. ? Documentation of method used for random sample selection.? "Age" of product when received by testing facility and storage conditions prior to analysis. For smokeless tobacco brand names with episodic production during a calendar year, the total number of sampling dates is determined by the sum of the individual test frequencies, not to exceed four. For the purpose of the Protocol, episodic producti..TRUNCATED(inst2_730502)
Moist (wet) snuff portion packs nicotine content (nicotine_content__moistwet_snuff_portionpacks)
Dry Snuff portion packs nicotine content (nicotine_content__drysunff_portion_packs)
Snus portion packs Tobacco nicotine content (nicotine_content__snus_tobacco_portionpacks)
Pellet or Compressed Tobacco nicotine content (nicotine_content__pelletorcompressed_tobacco)
Moist (wet) snuff portion packs unionized (free) nicotine (unionizedfree_nicotine__moistwet_snuff_portionpacks)
Dry Snuff portion packs unionized (free) nicotine (unionizedfree_nicotine__drysunff_portion_packs)
Snus portion packs Tobacco unionized (free) nicotine (unionizedfree_nicotine__snus_tobacco_portionpacks)
Pellet or Compressed Tobacco unionized (free) nicotine (unionizedfree_nicotine__pelletorcompressed_tobacco)

form.longName: PhenX PX730801 - Tobacco Product Adulteration Vent Or Filter Blocking
form.preferredDefinition: The Kozlowski et al. interviewer-administered protocol consists of eight fixed-response questions and one open-ended question asking respondents whether they currently or have ever used filter or vent blocked cigarettes and their perceptions of the effects of doing so.

module.longName: Tobacco Product Adulteration - Vent or Filter Blocking
module.preferredDefinition: Tobacco Product Adulteration - Vent or Filter Blocking

question.questionText: Have you ever seen or heard that one or more rings of small holes are on the filters of some cigarettes? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_smallholes_filtersencoded)
How do you know about these holes? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_howdo_youknow)

validValue.meaningText: Read about them in the news or magazine
validValue.description: Read about them in the news or magazine

validValue.meaningText: Saw a television advertisement about them
validValue.description: Saw a television advertisement about them

validValue.meaningText: Saw or heard a news report about them
validValue.description: Saw or heard a news report about them

question.questionText: Did you ever try to block the filter holes on cigarettes? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_ever_black_holesencoded)
How did you block the filter holes? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_how_blockholes)
At the present time do you block holes when you smoke? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_presenttime_blackholesencoded)
Do you think that blocking filter holes would make a cigarette taste stronger, milder, or have no effect? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_thinkblocking_effecttaste)
Do you think that blocking filter holes would increase, decrease, or have no effect on the tar a smoker gets from these cigarettes? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_thinkblocking_effecttar)
Do you think that blocking filter holes would increase, decrease, or have no effect on the nicotine a smoker gets form these cigarettes? (cigarettefilter_ventilation_thinkblocking_effectnicotine)

Analyses: Responses to the last three questions were recoded in the following manner: those who responded "no effect," "a little milder," "moderately milder," "a lot milder," or "don't know" to the question regarding the effect of blocking on cigarette taste, for example, were classified as being "unaware." Similarly, those participants who responded "no effect," "slightly decrease," "moderately decrease," "greatly decrease," or "don't know" to the questions regarding the effect of blocking on tar and nicotine yields were also classified as being "unaware." Response percentages were calculated within each brand category, with 95% confidence intervals (CIs). Betweengroup tests were done using analyses of variance with Bonferroni adjustments for comparisons or with X2 analyses.30 Withingroup comparisons were done with paired t tests. Multiple regression analyses (ordinary least squares, linear probability model) were used to explore predictors of knowledge of vents (scored 1 = yes, 2 = no, don't know) and knowledge that blocking increased tar intake (scored 1 = increase tar, 2 = no effect, decrease tar, don't know). Brand category was included in the regression analyses to adjust for group membership effects. All probability values are for twosided tests. (analyses_730801)

protocol.longName: Tobacco Product Adulteration - Vent or Filter Blocking
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Kozlowski et al. interviewer-administered protocol consists of eight fixed-response questions and one open-ended question asking respondents whether they currently or have ever used filter or vent blocked cigarettes and their perceptions of the effects of doing so.

form.longName: PhenX PX730901 - Tobacco Warning Label Exposure And Recall
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study and the 2015 International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to assess the effectiveness of health warnings on tobacco packages, which have been associated with perceptions of risk and may promote smoking cessation and reduce uptake among young people.

module.longName: Tobacco Warning Label Exposure and Recall
module.preferredDefinition: Tobacco Warning Label Exposure and Recall

question.questionText: In the past 30 days, how often, if at all, have you read or looked closely at the health warnings on cigarette packages? (healthwarnings_past30days_cigarettepackages)

I want you to think about the health warnings that currently appear on the exterior of CIGARETTE PACKS. I'd like you to describe the first warning that comes to mind, if any. (healthwarnings_cigarettepacks_exterior_describe_first)
Please describe the next health warning that comes to mind. (healthwarnings_cigarettepacks_exterior_describe_next)
Do any others come to mind? (healthwarnings_cigarettepacks_exterior_describe_others)
SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Cigarette Smoke Contains Carbon Monoxide. (healthwarnings_surgeongenerals_warning_carbonmonoxide)
SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Quitting Smoking Now Greatly Reduces Serious Risks to Your Health. (healthwarnings_surgeongenerals_warning_quitting)
SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Smoking Causes Lung Cancer, Heart Disease, Emphysema, and May Complicate Pregnancy. (healthwarnings_surgeongenerals_warning_canceretc)

protocol.longName: Tobacco Warning Label Exposure and Recall
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study and the 2015 International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to assess the effectiveness of health warnings on tobacco packages, which have been associated with perceptions of risk and may promote smoking cessation and reduce uptake among young people.
